CatDescriptText: Mr. Chester A. Lee, 7205 Hermitage Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?"  Answer reads: "I think they do not exercise the voting rights. If they did, things would be much better."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Chester A. Lee wearing light colored shirt and standing in front of brick building with metal railing
